eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: jeremy.leriche22@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RandomColor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create a random color for a scene, an object, or any other color input.
description: Allows you to create a random color.
To use it, go in the text area to set a color and type `RandomColor::CreateRandomColor()`.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a totally random color.
eventsFunctions.name: CreateRandomColor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Quickly remap Behavior controls to different keys.
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a Top-Down behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForTopdown

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a custom control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a custom scheme
eventsFunctions.name: SetCustom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remap controls of _PARAM0_: Up: _PARAM2_, Left: _PARAM3_, Down: _PARAM4_, Right: _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a preset control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a preset
eventsFunctions.name: SetPreset

events.comment: QWERTY bindings
AZERTY bindings
Numpad bindings
QWERTY player 2 bindings

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a platformer behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForPlatformer

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Platformer behavior controls to a custom control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Platformer controls to a custom scheme
eventsFunctions.name: SetCustom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remap controls of _PARAM0_: Up: _PARAM2_, Left: _PARAM3_, Down: _PARAM4_, Right: _PARAM5_, Jump: _PARAM6_

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Platformer behavior controls to a preset control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Platformer controls to a preset
eventsFunctions.name: SetPreset

events.comment: QWERTY bindings
AZERTY bindings
Numpad bindings
QWERTY player 2 bindings

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RenderToSprite
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Renders an object, layer or scene and puts the resulting image into a sprite.
description: Allows rendering (creating an image) of objects, layers and the scene to display in a sprite.
This allows to make optimizations by transforming the resulting image of a shape painter into a faster sprite, or to make viewports/cameras.

eventsFunctions.description: Renders an object and puts the rendered image into a sprite object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Render an object into a sprite
eventsFunctions.name: RenderObject

inlineCode: // Reset position so that it is not offscreen while rendering
const { position: { x: originalX, y: originalY } } = source;
const { width, height, x, y } = source.getLocalBounds();
// Ensure the target is a RenderTexture of the correct size

eventsFunctions.description: Renders a layer and puts the rendered image into a sprite object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Render a layer into a sprite
eventsFunctions.name: RenderLayer

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a RenderTexture of the correct size
// Prerender to a temporary texture to prevent WebGL erroring out.
// Ensure the original width/heigth is restored

eventsFunctions.description: Renders the scene and puts the rendered image into a sprite object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Render the scene into a sprite
eventsFunctions.name: RenderScene
eventsFunctions.sentence: Render the current scene into sprite _PARAM1_

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a RenderTexture of the correct size
// Prerender to a temporary texture to prevent WebGL erroring out.
// Ensure the original width/heigth is restored

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TiledUnitsBar
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ResourceBar

events.comment: This is done after the events to allow users to read the previous value at the end of the change.

eventsFunctions.description: the value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Value

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is empty.
eventsFunctions.name: IsEmpty

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is full.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFull

eventsFunctions.description: the previous high value of the resource bar before the current change.
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousHighValue

eventsFunctions.description: Force the previous resource value to update to the current one.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdatePreviousHighValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update the previous resource value of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: the previous high value conservation duration (in seconds) of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousHighValueDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: the previous high value conservation duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the resource value is changing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsChanging

propertyDescriptors.label: Previous high value conservation duration (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: PreviousHighValueDuration

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: TiledUnitsBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterBar

eventsFunctions.description: the value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Value

events.comment: The value is clamped by the behavior. This is why Object.Value() is used instead of Value directly.

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is empty.
eventsFunctions.name: IsEmpty

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is full.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFull

propertyDescriptors.description: It's used to detect a change at hot reload.
propertyDescriptors.name: PreviousInitialValue

propertyDescriptors.label: Unit width
propertyDescriptors.description: How much pixels to show for a value of 1.
propertyDescriptors.name: UnitWidth

propertyDescriptors.description: Only used by the scene editor.
propertyDescriptors.name: BarVerticalAnchorOrigin

propertyDescriptors.description: Only used by the scene editor.
propertyDescriptors.name: BarVerticalAnchorTarget

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpeedRestrictions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Limit the maximum movement and rotation speed of an object from forces or the physics behavior.
description: Limit the maximum movement and rotation speed of an object from forces or the physics behavior.
- Add the behavior that matches the method used to move the object (forces or physics)
- Set the maximum speed value in the behavior properties
- This only affects movement caused by forces or physics behavior
- This may not affect movement caused by other behaviors (platformer, top-down, draggable, etc)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum speed an object will move from (non-physics) forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxMovementSpeed_Forces

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum speed an object will move from physics forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxMovementSpeed_Physics

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum rotation speed of an object from physics forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxRotationSpeed_Physics

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
- Moving along the border of another object (inside, center, outside)
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).
This game shows how to make objects move around the border of another object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://moving-saw-platformer)).
This example can be used to test different settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsFunctions.description: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object
eventsFunctions.name: DistanceToClosestEdge
eventsFunctions.sentence: Distance from _PARAM1_ to the closest edge of _PARAM2_

events.comment: If point is inside rectangle, just use min distance

parameters:
min(
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY()),
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX())
)

events.comment: If point is outside rectangle, find distance to clamped position on rectangle

parameters:
DistanceBetweenPositions(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(),
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight()),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom())
)

eventsFunctions.description: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of an object. Run once, or every time the center object moves.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of an object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveAlongBorderOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update rectangular movement of _PARAM1_ to follow the border of _PARAM3_. Position on border: _PARAM4_

events.name: Create object link (if one has not been created)
Set a valid initial value by picking any Center object
Update value if distance is lower than existing minimum
Link objects that have the closest distance

events.comment: Link the MovingObject that has the shortest distance (and don't create more links even if another object has the same distance)

events.name: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of object

eventsFunctions.description: Move to the nearest corner of the center object.

eventsFunctions.name: MoveToNearestCorner
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ to the nearest corner of _PARAM3_

events.name: Create a link to the closest object

events.comment: Distance to TopLeft (don't use a condition on the first check so the variable starts with a valid corner)
Distance to TopRight
Distance to BottomLeft
Distance to BottomRight

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangleMovement

events.comment: Set the initial state according to the configuration.
Update the rectangle when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Move the object on the rectangular path.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Step on the path.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time the object takes to go through a vertical edge (in seconds).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: - smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY
